[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rate-limiter/src/main.rs] [Constant: CHUNK_SIZE] [Buffer overflow risk] Could CHUNK_SIZE be set to values larger than available memory, causing out-of-memory errors in the fixed-size buffer allocations at line 198 and 217, potentially crashing validator nodes during rate limiter tests? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rate-limiter/src/main.rs] [Function: run_experiment()] [Panic propagation] Does the .expect() call at line 114 properly propagate panics from spawned tasks, or could silent failures in rate limiter tests mask critical security vulnerabilities in production rate limiting code?
